description: 4D trajectory prediction involves forecasting the future positions of moving objects in a three-dimensional space over time, incorporating factors such as speed and direction. This is particularly critical in fields like air traffic management where accurate predictions can enhance safety and efficiency.
you_have_this_if: You are working on real-time tracking of moving objects.
You need to manage multiple trajectories simultaneously.
You require high accuracy in predictions to avoid collisions.
You are constrained by computational resources.
You are dealing with dynamic environments where conditions change rapidly.

approaches.best_for: When you need to predict aircraft trajectories in real-time for air traffic management.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach balances prediction accuracy with computational efficiency.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need a lightweight model that can run on standard CPUs or embedded devices while maintaining high prediction accuracy.

start_here: Start with the RCBAM–TCN–LSTM technique as it is specifically designed for real-time trajectory prediction while being computationally efficient.
